images.copyright: Mosaic façade in Registan Square, Samarkand, Uzbekistan (© da-kuk/Getty Images)
images.title: Tile tales
images.caption: Registan Square, Samarkand, Uzbekistan
images.desc: Gather 'round, explorers, as we tiptoe into the Registan Square in the city of Samarkand, Uzbekistan! Meaning 'sandy place' or 'desert' in Persian, Registan was the center of activity during the Timurid Empire. The square embodied the essence of the Timurid Renaissance, a period of cultural and intellectual revival, which spread throughout the Muslim world between the 14th and early 16th centuries CE.
